channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: We DON'T need to tax the fat
item.description: JANET STREET-PORTER: In fact well-upholstered Government food advisor Henry Dimbleby doesn't look like a stranger to the odd moment of self-indulgence himself.

item.title: Graphs show surge in cases among men in their twenties... and spike coincides with Euro 2020
item.description: Cases have remained roughly the same between men and women throughout the pandemic. But they began to diverge after June 13, when England played its first match.

item.title: Up to a THIRD more Brits doubled jabbed with AstraZeneca could get Covid symptoms compared to Pfizer
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: People double jabbed with AstraZeneca could be three times more likely to get symptoms of the virus than those who got Pfizer and Moderna, according to SAGE figures.

item.title: Manchester mother demands apology from public health and police chiefs
item.description: Officers visited the home of Kathryn Crook in Middleton, Greater Manchester, to check that Charlotte was adhering to Covid guidance after catching the virus.

item.title: Dozens dead and missing after torrential rain triggered flooding in Europe
item.description: Torrential downpours overnight triggered flash flooding across large parts of western Europe on Thursday, with more than 40 people dead and 70 missing - most of them in Germany.

item.title: Shocking £525 cost for a single Covid test: Holidaymakers confronted with extortionate prices
item.description: A Daily Mail analysis of 15 firms found that, in some cases, true prices were up to three times more expensive than stated on the Government website. One company charged up to £525 for a single test.

item.title: Tory candidate who stabbed neighbour to death walks free from court
item.description: Former Tory candidate Connor Rumble and his flat mate Grant Gardner were acquitted of the murder of Adam Le Roi following a trial at Preston Crown Court.

item.title: Warnings of cancelled operations as NHS
item.description: The 'pingdemic' is causing chaos for families and firms and hospitals are scrapping operations because so many workers are having to self isolate, it has been revealed.

item.title: TOM LEONARD: Drugs, rows and how some of rock's greatest albums erupted from a tiny volcanic island
item.description: TOM LEONARD: Whether it was the cannabis plants delivered to the door or the volcano looming in the background, no rock or pop star ever quite forgets recording at AIR Montserrat.

item.title: Face masks expected to remain in supermarkets, police and NHS beyond July 19 Freedom Day
item.description: Britain's biggest retailers, say safeguards will remain in place, and police officers and the NHS will continue to use face masks and social distancing for staff and patients as a safety measure.

item.title: No brown sugar! Mick Jagger rolls up to back controversial 'snack tax' on sugary and salty food
item.description: The Rolling Stones frontman, 77, praised the National Food Strategy proposals and said they would lead to a 'big change for the better'.

item.title: Report confirms £58,000 sum for lavish Downing Street renovation WAS paid by the Tory party
item.description: An official report has revealed that the highly unusual funding arrangements for the No 11 Downing Street refurbishment had to be hastily unravelled after the Mail broke the story.

item.title: LIZ JONES says stars dressing like Disney princesses is a glimmer of happier times ahead
item.description: LIZ JONES: There has been a red carpet explosion - at the Oscars, Golden Globes and in Cannes - of Disney princess dresses and, my goodness, it is gorgeous.
item.media:credit: Marcus Mam / Matt Frost/ITV/REX / Allstar/Disney / Law Roach/Instagram / Chris Pizzello/Pool/REX / HFPA/ZUMA Wire/REX

item.title: HENRY DEEDES: Daft slogans in Bren gun spurts ...whizz-bang Boris is reborn
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: The PM travelled to the UK Battery Industrialisation Centre in Coventry to make a speech on his levelling-up agenda and looked reborn from the moment he arrived.

item.title: TikTok stars the Smithy family say they have been victims of arson attack
item.description: The footage, exclusively obtained by MailOnline, shows the car on fire in the driveway of the Smithy family's home in Welling, south-east London, following the arson attack last night.

item.title: Bexy Cameron reveals shocking truth about growing up in a religious sect in Britain
item.description: Filmmaker Bexy Cameron's family joined The Children Of God cult in 1972 and for a while were the public face of the movement, which ran communes across the world.

item.title: Baby is rushed to hospital after being injured at Asda store
item.description: The infant was taken to hospital after roof panels fell from the ceiling of the Asda store in Ashton-under-Lyne, Greater Manchester, and landed on the trolley they were sat in.

item.title: Melinda Gates enjoys a girls' weekend with her daughter Jennifer, 25, in NYC
item.description: Melinda, 56, was all smiles as she enjoyed a getaway in the Big Apple with her eldest daughter and her daughter's friends.

item.title: The Simpsons predicts ANOTHER major event with 2014 show showing Richard Branson space flight
item.description: The Simpsons correctly predicted Sir Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic spaceflight in a 2014 episode before the businessman, 70, launched himself towards the stars on Sunday.

item.title: Woman reveals her dad named her after his mistress
item.description: Kristina Fletcher, 31, from Crestwood, Kentucky, shared the shocking origin story behind her name on TikTok last week.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Boris's pingers are doing more damage than Scargill's pickets ever did
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: The trigger-happy Test and Trace system is causing chaos. Soon there may be two million perfectly healthy employees stuck indoors when they could be helping Britain get back on its feet.

item.title: Denmark set for trial plans to send refugees, migrants and asylum seekers to African offshore hubs
item.description: JAMES KRISTOFFER MILES: Rwanda is seen as the most obvious potential partner as Denmark pursues its strategy of transporting asylum seekers to 'offshore hubs' outside Europe.

item.title: 18-year-old physics student takes place of $28M auction winner to fly with Jeff Bezos to space
item.description: Blue Origin said Thursday that 18-year-old physics student Oliver Daemen will take the place of the anonymous bidder to fly to space and be the 'first paying customer' to fly on the New Shepard rocket.

item.title: Darts icon and former world champion Andy Fordham dies, aged 59
item.description: Fordham faced health problems during his life and once weighed 31 stone, revealing that he would drink 25 bottles of lager a day. He contracted coronavirus in January this year.

item.title: Boris Johnson dismisses dramatic anti-obesity plan put forward by food tsar Henry Dimbleby
item.description: The PM said he would study a report published yesterday by his food tsar, Henry Dimbleby, but dismissed its headline recommendations out of hand.

item.title: The sole surviving example of British Guiana 1c Magenta stamp will be displayed in London
item.description: The world's rarest stamp will soon be on display in London,at the headquarters of dealer Stanley Gibbons, which recently paid $8.3 million (£6.2 million) for it at an auction in New York.

item.title: New book reveals how, even today, women are belittled and patronised
item.description: British author Mary Ann Sieghart's book is about the 'authority gap', the fact that 'however much we claim to believe in equality, we are still more reluctant to accord authority to women than to men'.

item.title: Rising inflation sets alarm bells ringing at the Bank of England
item.description: Central bank official Michael Saunders said inflation could hit 4 per cent later this year. He warned action might be required as soon as next month to put a lid on the cost of living.

item.title: Revolut is UK's most valuable fintech firm with a £24bn price tag
item.description: The banking app earned the accolade after successfully closing a £577m funding round with Japanese investment giant Softbank and Tiger Global Management.

item.title: WHO head admits it is too soon to rule out a link between Covid-19 and a lab leak
item.description: The head of WHO, Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, has said there was a 'premature push' to rule out a potential link between the coronavirus pandemic and a lab leak in Wuhan.

item.title: WHO says pandemic 'nowhere near finished' with 'strong likelihood' of new dangerous Covid variants
item.description: 'The pandemic is nowhere near finished,' the committee said in a statement, highlighting 'the likelihood for new and possibly more dangerous variants of concern.

item.title: Air industry blasts government over axing of Ibiza, Majorca and Menorca from green list
item.description: EasyJet CEO Johan Lundgren accused ministers of a 'double standard where (foreign) travel is treated differently to the domestic economy' after the move was announced last night.

item.title: Fears of casualties as serious crash closes A1 in County Durham
item.description: A HGV crossed the central reservation of the A1(M) between Bradbury and Carville in Co Durham following an incident on the road around 6.30pm.

item.title: 2,700-year-old pig skeleton found home in Jerusalem suggests some ancient Jews ate pork
item.description: The complete skeleton of a seven-month-old pig that lived 2,700 years ago has been found inside a home of an early elite Jewish family, suggesting some ate pork that was forbidden by religious law.
item.media:credit: Joe Uziel/Israel Antiquities Authority / Tel Aviv University / Oscar Bejerano/Israel Antiquities Authority

item.title: Two men found fatally shot at former Versace Mansion 'died by suicide'
item.description: Police in Florida said a preliminary investigation has found that Adam Rashap, 31, and Alexander Gross, 30, died from gunshot wounds to the head in an apparent double suicide.

item.title: Ashton Kutcher bought ticket for next Virgin Galactic flight but Mila Kunis got him to sell it back
item.description: Ashton Kutcher has revealed that he bought a ticket for the next Virgin Galactic flight into space - only to then sell it back. The 43-year-old revealed his wife Mila Kunis persuaded him not to go.
item.media:credit: Cheddar News/Twitter / Getty Images for Disney

item.title: Cannes Film Festival 2021: Kimberley Garner flashes her bottom with Georgina Rodriguez
item.description: Kimberley Garner left very little to the imagination as she flashed her bottom at the France premiere during Cannes Film Festival on Thursday.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / WireImage / REUTERS / AFP via Getty Images

item.title: BLM blames 'cruel and inhumane' US embargoes for Cuban unrest and praises communist regime
item.description: The group blamed 'cruel and inhumane' US embargoes for Cuban unrest while praising the island nation for harboring convicted US cop killer and former Black Panther Assata Shakur.

item.title: Rebekah Vardy's company is £36k in debt
item.description: Rebekah Vardy has suffered another financial blow amid her expensive legal battle with WAG rival Coleen Rooney.

item.title: Meghan Markle named new animated series she's creating for Netflix after herself
item.description: The 39-year-old announced on Wednesday that she is creating and producing an animated series for Netflix as part of the Sussexes' lucrative deal with the site.

item.title: Judge rules 'appropriate accommodation' must be found for troubled boy restrained in hospital
item.description: Mr Justice MacDonald was told that the youngster is subjected to chemical and physical restraint at the hospital, where as many as 13 police officers have been present in an effort to control his behaviour.

item.title: Emma Bunton offers the best glimpse of her thigh-skimming wedding dress yet as she shares new photo
item.description: Emma Bunton, 45, has shared another photo of her stunning bridal dress following her secret wedding to long-term beau Jade Jones on Tuesday.

item.title: NASA's $1.1 billion Juno spacecraft snaps 'starship captain' view images of Jupiter and Ganymede
item.description: NASA's Juno captured stunning images of Jupiter and its moon, Ganymede. The spectacular time-lapse takes viewers within 645 miles of Ganymede and 2,100 miles above Jupiter.

item.title: Pentagon admits Colombians arrested for assassinating Haiti president were trained by US military
item.description: Lt. Col. Ken Hoffman said a 'small number' of suspects had participated in US military training while serving in the Colombian military.
item.media:credit: Facebook / via REUTERS / Police Nationale d'Haiti / AP

item.title: Sugar tax: FEMAIL reveals how a basket of family favourites could cost an extra £247.86 a year
item.description: Proposals to add a tax of £3 per kilogram on sugar and £6 per kilogram on salt sold wholesale for use in processed foods are included in a new National Food Strategy, published today for the UK.

item.title: Fashion CEO who quit her 'ultra-Orthodox' Jewish upbringing documents life in Netflix series
item.description: Julia Haart, 50, is the CEO of Elite World Group. She was raised in the Hasidic Jewish enclave of Monsey, New York, where she says 'women were to be rarely seen and never heard.'

item.title: Campaigners call for bird names with links to colonialism to be changed
item.description: Jameson's Firefinch and Blyth's Reed Warbler are among those set to have their namesakes replaced by less 'offensive' monickers due to US-based campaign group, reports the Telegraph.
item.media:credit: Shutterstock / Mikhail Vedernikov / Shutterstock / Pascale Gueret / Shutterstock / PACO COMO

item.title: Government splashes £73K on topping up its fine wine cellar
item.description: Purchases in the last financial year saw an extra £26,185 splashed out compared to the period before, according to a document laid out in Parliament on Thursday.

item.title: Postmen wear hardhats and carry umbrellas to protect themselves from dive-bombing SEAGULLS
item.description: Rogue seagulls have been reportedly attacking posties in the swanky coastal resort of Thorpe Bay, Essex as locals reveal the 'terrifying' attacks they've been enduring in recent weeks.

item.title: UNMASKED: Rapist schoolboy who strangled and attacked four children
item.description: Egan Ritchie committed a string of offences including two counts of rape, two counts of serious sexual assault and assault to danger of life in the East Ayrshire area between July 3 and August 6, 2019.

item.title: Lancet letter which demanded Freedom Day be scrapped was signed by people NO scientific credentials
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The document accused the UK Government of conducting a 'dangerous and unethical experiment' by pressing on with the July 19 unlocking despite soaring infection rates.

item.title: Megacomet 1,000 times larger than a normal comet has first signs of activity from its massive core
item.description: Astronomers spotted the first activity on the megacomet C/2014 UN271, spotting signs of a coma, a zone of spreading of gas and dust spreading, marking the first time they had seen it as active.

item.title: Female drunk driver, Amanda McVinnie, 30, is banned for three years
item.description: Amanda McVinnie, of Standish, Wigan, was disqualified from driving at Bolton Crown Court on Thursday after an incident outside her ex-boyfriend's house in April.

item.title: Euro 2020: Coach arrested over racist post to Rashford admits he 'may have sent tweet while drunk'
item.description: Nick Scott, from Powick, near Worcester, originally denied sending the tweet after the England striker missed a penalty in the Euros final at Wembley, claiming that his Twitter account had been hacked.

item.title: 'Dozens' of people are being investigated by police for racist tweets about the England team
item.description: Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Bukayo Saka were targeted with racial abuse in the wake of the Three Lion's defeat on penalties to Italy in Sunday's final.

item.title: Bukayo Saka breaks his silence on his England penalty miss
item.description: Bukayo Saka has spoken out for the first time since missing a penalty in England's Euro 2020 final defeat to Italy, claiming that he knew instantly that he would be targeted by racist abuse.

item.title: PM insists 'levelling up' agenda WON'T hurt Tory heartlands
item.description: In a speech in Coventry, Boris Johnson insisted that his drive to boost 'Red Wall' areas where the Tories have been surging politically does not mean 'rich areas get poorer'.

item.title: First baby beaver to be born on Exmoor in 400 years is named after Marcus Rashford
item.description: The baby beaver which was captured on camera on the National Trust's Holnicote Estate in Somerset earlier this week has been named after the England footballer Marcus Rashford.

item.title: Is UK government advisor Henry Dimbleby's Leon fast food chain really that healthy?
item.description: Henry Dimbleby, an Oxford University educated businessman and Boris Johnson's food tsar, today called for the tax to be slapped on junk food.

item.title: Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall attend the Great Yorkshire Show in Harrogate
item.description: It may have been an early start for the Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, but the couple looked fresh as a daisy as they arrived at the Great Yorkshire Show this morning.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson reveals she 'never feuded' with her 'brave best friend' Princess Diana
item.description: Duchess of York , 61, who met Diana when they were teenagers told People: 'We promised each other we would always be together - there was never any daylight between us.'

item.title: Ex-Sunderland footballer who killed his 77-year-old father is jailed for nearly 12 years
item.description: Ex-Sunderland AFC and Hartlepool United player Paul Conlon, 43, punched, throttled and hit Harry Conlon with a Converse shoe during the deadly violence.

item.title: Georgia woman becomes bodybuilder at 64
item.description: In 2019, Julia Olson, from Georgia, 64, embarked on a new fitness regime and when she started working with a coach, he encouraged her to consider a bikini contest.
item.media:credit: CATERS NEWS / JEFF BINNS / CATERS NEWS

item.title: Goose waits diligently outside Massachusetts wildlife center as injured mate has foot surgery
item.description: A Canada goose named Arnold undergoing surgery got an unexpected visitor when his longtime mate stopped by the Cape Wildlife Center in Massachusetts to make check in on him.

item.title: The Grand Tour Presents: Lochdown FIRST LOOK
item.description: The Amazon Prime Video show will follow Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May as they attempt to cross a plastic bridge in the middle of a lake in 1970s American cars.

item.title: Italian footballer Marco Verratti marries his model girlfriend Jessica Aidi
item.description: Italian footballer Marco Verratti was first spotted with the brunette beauty at the Monaco Grand Prix in 2019, just months after the PSG footballer announced his divorce from wife Laura Zazzara.

item.title: Princess Madeleine of Sweden's husband stays in her seat while she has a boogie at concert
item.description: Princess Madeleine, 39, appeared in great spirits as she danced during a performance at Solliden Sessions near Borgholm on Saturday 10 July, while her husband Chris remained seated.

item.title: Vaccinated people now make up almost 47% of all new Covid cases, symptom-tracking app claims
item.description: King's College London scientists estimated 33,118 people were catching the virus daily in the week ending July 10 - compared to 33,723 in the previous seven-day spell.

item.title: Devastated Dani Dyer takes shamed Sammy Kimmence's car back to dealership
item.description: The Love Island star, 26, was joined by her mum Joanne and seven-month-old son Santiago as she dropped the car to the dealership in the wake of the conman's incarceration

item.title: Lost village on rugged hilltops in Snowdonia bids for World Heritage status
item.description: Gwynedd Council chiefs have launched a bid to have the mines around Blaenau Ffestiniog, Wales, awarded World Heritage Site status after it has been compared to Peru's Machu Picchu.

item.title: Answering work emails out of hours increases your risk of stress, experts warn
item.description: The study led by the University of South Australia surveyed more than 2,200 academic and professional employees across 40 universities from June to November 2020.

item.title: Further education students in England face fresh disruption
item.description: Employees of three London colleges that are part of Capital City College Group voted to strike over working conditions and compulsory redundancies alongside pay.

item.title: Politics professor wins £70,000 libel damages over false claims he is a sex predator and rapist
item.description: Academic Paul Blackledge was accused of being a sexual predator and rapist by an anonymous blogger. He has been awarded £70,000 in damages by the High Court for the 'grave defamation'.

item.title: Supermarkets want customers and staff to continue wearing masks after 'Freedom Day' on July 19
item.description: Tesco, Asda, Aldi and Waitrose have become the latest retailers to say they will encourage customers and shop workers to continue wearing masks in their supermarkets from July 19.

item.title: AI girl group called Skullz will release NFTs rather than singles
item.description: Skullz is an emo pop trio inspired by the Spice Girls and K-pop bands like BTS from Seoul, South Korea. Skullz consists of three members that only exist as avatars in the 'metaverse' - a virtual shared space.

item.title: Covid-19 UK: Union warns factories are 'on the verge of shutting' amid pingdemic chaos
item.description: Up to 10 per cent of staff working at Nissan's manufacturing plant in Sunderland were told to self-isolate by the NHS app. Unions warned the country is on the verge of shutting down.

item.title: Covid UK: Nightclubs plan to open as soon as Freedom Day starts on Monday
item.description: Nightclubs across England are planning on throwing so-called 'freedom raves' from 12am on Monday, when most legal restrictions on social contact imposed during the pandemic are scrapped.

item.title: German long jumper reveals how athletes crave hook-ups during the Olympics
item.description: This year, organisers have provided 160,000 condoms in the Tokyo Olympic Village. However, Covid-19 means athletes can't come within two metres of each other.

item.title: PM launches town centre revival plan with £10m 'chewing gum taskforce'
item.description: The government is stepping up a campaign to rescue urban centres across England after they were 'hollowed out' during the pandemic.

item.title: Brazilian woman with vitiligo reveals it has turned her almost completely white
item.description: Stephanie Yashinmura, 28, from Rio de Janeiro, discovered a white spot above her eye when she was 14 years old, and it spread across her entire body.

item.title: US Black Hawk helicopter drops out of sky, crashes through trees and lamp posts and crash lands
item.description: Video footage shows the US Black Hawk helicopter suddenly losing altitude and dropping down perilously close to a busy road before ploughing through trees and two lamp posts in Bucharest.

item.title: French judge is fired for offering sex with his daughter, 12, on wife-swapping website
item.description: Olivier Bailly, 55, was a vice-president of the law courts in Dijon, Burgundy, but was removed by the judicial disciplinary authority after advertising his 12-year-old daughter on partner-swapping site.

item.title: Who needs Ibiza? Sunseekers bask in 80F as temperatures soar to hotter than the Balearics
item.description: Britons descended upon Troon Beach in Ayrshire, Kelvingrove Park in Glasgow, Weymouth in Dorset, and Alum Chine Beach near Bournemouth to lap up the glorious summer weather.

item.title: Zara Tindall joins French sailing team during a practice ahead of Great Britain Sail Grand Prix
item.description: The Queen's granddaughter, 40, looked in great spirits as she joined France's team on the water during a practice session ahead of the high-octane sailing series in Plymouth.
item.media:credit: PA / Thomas Lovelock for SailGP / Ricardo Pinto for SailGP

item.title: University student satisfaction drops during coronavirus crisis
item.description: The latest National Student Survey (NSS) found that less than half of students in the UK believe their university or college took steps to support their mental wellbeing during the pandemic.

item.title: Lighthouse-inspired home on Grand Designs is FINALLY going on the market for £10million
item.description: Edward Short, 52, is finally ready to sell the extraordinary Chesil Cliff House, in Croyde, Devon, after spending a decade on the ambitious lighthouse-inspired project.

item.title: Man, 42, is arrested on suspicion of being behind vile racist social media post about England stars
item.description: Stars including Bukayo Saka, Marcus Rashford and Jadon Sancho have been subjected to horrendous online racial abuse since the Three Lions lost to Italy on penalties on Sunday.

item.title: Steve McQueen's iconic 1970 Porsche 917K from 'Le Mans' set to fetch $18.5M in auction
item.description: The 1970 Porsche 917K that drove Steve McQueen to victory in the film 'Le Mans' is set to fetch $18.5M at Sotheby's auction next month in New York.
item.media:credit: AFP via Getty Images / Getty Images

item.title: Britain sets up new Brexit battle by offering 'divorce bill' £3.5billion LESS that Brussels wants
item.description: The Treasury confirmed this afternoon that it estimates the UK should have to pay Brussels £37.3billion to severe its ties to the bloc. Last week the EU's own estimate set the fee at £40.8billion.

item.title: Norwich pub is first in Britain to BAN punters who can't prove they've had Covid vaccine
item.description: Landlord Philip Cutter, 50, has been subjected to vile abuse since an anti-vax forum highlighted his new rule at The Gardeners Arms pub in Norwich, Norfolk.

item.title: Murder detectives say newborn baby who was found in canal was 'alive for hours' before dying
item.description: West Midlands Police are still attempting to trace the mother of the newborn baby boy, whose body was found in the Wyrley and Essington Canal in Rough Wood country park, in Walsallm on May 20.

item.title: Dutch crime reporter, 64, dies nine days after being shot in Amsterdam
item.description: Peter R. de Vries, known for his work in exposing the Dutch underworld, was shot in downtown Amsterdam around 7.30pm last week while walking to his car.

item.title: Six British teenage girls from top public school are trapped in Greek quarantine hotel
item.description: The girls - 17 and 18 - must isolate at a hotel in Zante for a fortnight after one of them tested positive for Covid on Saturday as they prepared to fly home from a week partying after the end of their A-levels.

item.title: Unilever to add carbon footprint labels to its products this year
item.description: Carbon footprint labels will feature on to around two dozen products 'in either North America or Europe' as part of a pilot by British consumer goods giant Unilever, based in London.

item.title: Nightclubs rebel against Government's Covid passport plan with 80% refusing to use them
item.description: Finding from poll of 250 businesses will put them on a collision path with ministers who have asked them to voluntarily use the system when they reopen but could make them mandatory.

item.title: Glaucoma: New blood test 15 TIMES more likely to identify high-risk people before vision loss
item.description: The effectiveness of the test was assessed on a total of 413,8344 individual with and without glaucoma by researchers from Australia's Flinders University.

item.title: Princess Leonor, 15, and Sofia of Spain, 14, undertake first joint outing without parents
item.description: They are joining their parents King Felipe of Spain and Queen Letizia at royal engagements more and more, and now Princess Leonor and Infanta Sofia have branched out on their own.

item.title: Mayfair casino allowed multi-millionaire clients racially abuse black croupiers, tribunal hears
item.description: A Mayfair casino has been accused of ignoring high-rolling multi-millionaire clients racially abusing its croupiers because they were afraid of losing their custom

item.title: Richard Branson wants to be known as a 'creative who makes special things' not a 'billionaire'
item.description: In his first UK interview since his Virgin Galactic space mission, the British entrepreneur spoke with Lorraine Kelly live from his home on Necker Island this morning.

item.title: Mother, 39, accused of manslaughter after her seven-year-old son died is remanded in custody
item.description: Laura Heath, of Nechells, Birmingham, appeared art Birmingham Magistrate's Court on Thursday charged with manslaughter and four counts of child cruelty. She was remanded until August 12.

item.title: Thousands of FLYING ANTS are emerging, encouraged by the hot and humid weather
item.description: Met Office radar detected millions of ants swarming over London during the finals of Wimbledon and the UEFA European Football Championship on Sunday.

item.title: Woman says Crowne Plaza London quarantine hotel is 'worse than prison'
item.description: Jackie Burchell was isolating at the Crowne Plaza London hotel at King's Cross after flying back from India where her husband was working in Chennai.

item.title: Bill Clinton took TWO MORE trips with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: A new podcast reveals that Bill Clinton flew on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet in February 2005 while visiting Japan, Taiwan and China.
item.media:credit: AFP via Getty Images / William J. Clinton Presidential Library

item.title: Furious mother brands Poundland 'disgusting' for selling crop tops for babies
item.description: Kate Clarky, from Medway, Kent, said she was appalled after spotting the top for sale for children aged up to two, and said that it will 'attract sickos' to children.

item.title: Grade II cottage that 'inspired Lewis Carroll's famous novel' hits market for £1m
item.description: Red Cottage is a striking Grade II listed property in Whitburn, Tyne and Wear, where Charles Dodgson - otherwise known as Lewis Carroll - regularly visited his family.

item.title: Has Covid-19 killed off your kid's holiday club?
item.description: Poll by TUC and campaign group Mother Pukka involved more than 36,000 mothers, and found that nearly one in eight do not have access to their usual holiday clubs.

item.title: Church braces for claims from 'victims' of Nine O'Clock Service that collapsed after sex scandal
item.description: Former members of the Nine O'Clock Service, set up in Sheffield in the 1980s, are considering legal action against the Church after allegations of sexual and emotional abuse were made in 1995.

item.title: Covid-19 UK: Alcohol deaths reach record levels after lockdown drove binge drinking at home
item.description: Data from Public Health England shows the number of alcoholic liver deaths - fatalities caused by build up of fat on the organ caused by drinking - jumped 21 per cent from 2019 to 2020.

item.title: Aston Martin unveils its £700,000 217mph hybrid Valhalla supercar
item.description: Aston Martin has gone back to the drawing board to rework the 2019 prototype hybrid supercar to ensure it could become a production reality that also makes money.

item.title: Snooker player John Higgins puts luxury Lanarkshire mansion up for sale for £825,000
item.description: Snooker star John Higgins has put his luxury mansion in Lanarkshire up for sale and hopes to pot offers of over £825,000.

item.title: Trinidadian RAF hero flyer fooled bosses into thinking that he was African royalty
item.description: A Trinidadian RAF airman who foiled Nazi efforts to shoot down 200 bombers duped superiors into believing he was African royalty.

item.title: Paedophile, 40, caught out in sting trying to give mobile phone to 14-year-old girl
item.description: This is the moment a paedophile was caught in Manchester arriving to hand a 14-year-old girl a mobile phone so she could take explicit pictures of herself for him.

item.title: Former gymnast sues for more than £150,000 after smashing her leg on Bear Grylls obstacle course
item.description: Former gymnast Margot Harrison, 58, from west London was left with a shattered leg that resembled a 'crushed biscuit' and a dislocated shoulder after taking on a Bear Grylls Survival Race.

item.title: World's first lab-grown FOIE GRAS is created from duck stem cells
item.description: The cell-based product has been developed by Paris startup Gourmey, which is aiming to create a number of sustainable alternatives to traditional, farmed meat.

item.title: Thieves steal Giles Coren's £65,000 eco-Jaguar for second time in three months
item.description: The TV presenter, 51, turned detective back in April after his beloved car was stolen but police told him they didn't have the 'manpower to investigate'.

item.title: Electronic devices are seized in Matt Hancock CCTV probe
item.description: The Information Commissioner's Office said they had retrieved the kit as part of an investigation into how the material emerged.

item.title: Netflix is planning an expansion into video games, report claims
item.description: Mike Verdu, a former executive of Electronic Arts (EA), the successful video games firm, has been appointed by the Los Gatos, California-based streaming giant.

item.title: Royal Parks contract cleaners will strike over pay and sacking of member of staff
item.description: Contract workers at the Royal Parks in London are demanding equal pay that is in line with those directly employed by the charity which runs them. They are also asking for a staff member to be reinstated.

item.title: UK competition watchdog fines drugs firms over £260m for overcharging NHS for hydrocortisone tablets
item.description: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) said pharmaceutical firms Auden Mckenzie and Actavis UK, inflated its price of hydrocortisone tablets for almost a decade.

item.title: Snake expert who claimed he was immune to venom is killed when cobra bites him as he 'kisses it'
item.description: Bernardo Alvarez, 62, was killed by the Northern Philippine Cobra in Pangasinan while his terrified neighbours watched on. Medics said he was not responsive when they arrived.

item.title: Families win fresh inquests after Gosport hospital deaths at the hands of 'Dr Opiate' Jane Barton
item.description: Permission has been granted for inquests to be held into the deaths of four patients who died at the Gosport War Memorial Hospital, which is being investigated over the care of hundreds of patients
item.media:credit: Solent News & Photo Agency / PA / Family/Solent News

item.title: These Levi's shorts are currently half price on Amazon
item.description: Is your wardrobe heatwave ready? Levi's Original 501 high waisted denim shorts are now reduced by half price on Amazon, making dressing for the warmer weather a whole lot easier.

item.title: Drug-driving mother-of-three avoids jail after filming herself on Snapchat at 88mph before M60 crash
item.description: Crystal Ward, 27, made a series of eight-second Snapchat videos which showed her speeding down the M60 near near Sale, Greater Manchester on June 11 last year before crashing.

item.title: Fury at 'nanny state meddling' over call for tax on sugary and salty food
item.description: Answering questions at an event in Coventry after the proposals emerged, Boris Johnson said he was not 'attracted' to the idea of imposing new burdens on hard-pressed families.

item.title: Egyptian mummy wrap linen fragments in New Zealand matched to those in the US
item.description: The discovery joins two long separated pieces of an ancient shroud together virtually, one from the Getty Institute in California, the other from the Teece Museum in New Zealand.

item.title: Shark attacks are rebranded as 'negative encounters' in Australia
item.description: Queensland and New South Wales are shifting away from using 'attacks' in a move, which scientists say is welcome, to change animals' image as a 'man-eating monster' (file photo).

item.title: Marcus Rashford and Jadon Sancho take a private jet to green-list Turks and Caicos
item.description: The duo are close friends, and they will now spend their time away after England's Euro 2020 final heartbreak - and before returning to training with United - living the high life in Turks and Caicos.

item.title: Black Covent Garden shop assistant wins £8,400 damages after manager branded her 'filth of society'
item.description: Aaliyah Stretch, who was one of the only black members of staff working at the Covent Garden store, has been awarded corrected manager Silvia Georghe after she mispronounced her name.

item.title: Profile on multimillionaire Eton-educated food tsar Henry Dimbleby
item.description: Oxford and Eton educated businessman Henry Dimbleby, 51, has proposed a world-fist 'snack tax' which could add £3.4billion a year to families' shopping bills.

item.title: Fascinating photos taken around the world capture abandoned remnants of bygone times
item.description: The ghosts of bygone times lie all around us. And here we present fascinating photos of them - pictures of abandoned buildings, boats, bridges and more that link the present with the past.
item.media:credit: Shutterstock / Janusz Lipinski / Shutterstock / Spiridonov Oleg / Shutterstock / Jack Hong / Shutterstock / sergioboccardo

item.title: FEMAIL reveals the middle aged women refusing to wear bras
item.description: British-American actress Gillian Anderson, 52, joked she doesn't care if her breasts 'reach her belly button' but that she's 'too lazy' to wear the undergarment when hosting an Instagram Live.

item.title: Vaccines tsar Kate Bingham is one of 40,000 double-jabbed Brits forced to put summer holiday plans
item.description: Dame Kate Bingham took part in early vaccine trials for Novavax but the jab but it is not approved by the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency and so is not recognised by the NHS

item.title: New figures put OAPs on track for an 8 PER CENT hike due to effects of Covid
item.description: Total wage growth excluding bonuses spiked to 6.6 per cent in the three months to May, according to the latest official data.

item.title: Amy Winehouse poses in unseen snaps as a child
item.description: The late singer looked sweet in the family picture as she sat in a garden chair with huge sunglasses on ahead of the upcoming documentary Reclaiming Amy about her life.
item.media:credit: Janis Winehouse Collins / BBC / Curious Films / Winehouse Family Photo

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg has sold Facebook shares EVERY business day since November
item.description: Zuckerberg, 37, has decreased his stake in Facebook from 28% at the time of the company's initial public offering in May 2012 to about 14%.
item.media:credit: AFP via Getty Images / Getty Images

item.title: Health: Scientists are developing a new type of pain medication from TARANTULA VENOM
item.description: Using computational biology techniques, a team from UC Davis are using computational biology techniques to turn poisonous peptides - small proteins - into useful ones.

item.title: World's first 3D-printed steel footbridge is unveiled in Amsterdam's Red Light District
item.description: The bridge, created by a Dutch company called MX3D, has been installed over the Oudezijds Achterburgwal canal in Amsterdam's Red Light District.

item.title: One of Britain's rarest butterflies has wings that look brown AND blue depending on how you look
item.description: The photograph of the rare Purple Emperor butterfly was taken by wildlife potographer Andrew Fusek Peters in Oversley Woods, Warwickshire, on Tuesday.

item.title: Shocking graphic reveals the devastating effects on the body after just one DAY of poor sleep
item.description: Body aches, low mood and a paler complexion are all possible after three nights of sleep deprivation, according to a series of CGI images created by Yorkshire-based mattress specialists Otty.

item.title: Driver smashed £170,000 Lamborghini into lamp post as dejected England fans poured out of pubs
item.description: Photos showed the blue supercar mangled following the prang in Handsworth, Birmingham, just before midnight on Sunday. Ten firefighters dashed to help but nobody was injured.

item.title: Boris's Union Jack jet grounded by Covid: RAF plane given £900k makeover flies abroad 'once' in 2021
item.description: The Airbus A330 Voyager was decked out in red, white and blue in the summer of 2020 to help the PM fly the flag for the UK when he travels to international summits.

item.title: This affordable double hammock with stand is a hanging egg chair alternative and it's on sale
item.description: The £83.93 Vivere Double Hammock offers the perfect reading nook or place to sip an ice-cold drink this summer; and is an affordable alternative to the hanging egg chair trend.

item.title: Grand Designs viewers are NOT convinced by makeover of £1million concrete 'bunker' house
item.description: Grand Designs viewers were left unimpressed by a £1million 'bunker' house in Lewes, East Sussex, after Kevin McCloud revisited the property on last night's episode.

item.title: Animal rights activists blockade McDonald's only UK burger factory with trucks and bamboo obstacles
item.description: Protestors from the Animal Rebellion group have set up bamboo structures and tents outside the OSI Food Solutions factory in Scunthorpe overnight in the latest stunt to target the restaurant giant.

item.title: Shocking phone footage reveals never-before-seen life for four British jihadis in ISIS
item.description: The contents of a device which belonged to three British jihadis have been shared with BBC Three for a new documentary - Secrets of an ISIS Smartphone.

item.title: Furious boatman is accused of trying to hit Wally the Walrus with his paddle
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: James Stedeford, who runs boat trips taking tourists to view wildlife on the Isles of Scilly, is said to have reacted in anger after his dinghy was tipped over by the 2,000lbs sea creature.

item.title: EU's top court says employers CAN ban religious clothing
item.description: Luxembourg-based tribunal said in its ruling that courts in bloc's 27 member states should weigh up whether ban corresponded to 'genuine need' on the part of the employer (file photo).

item.title: Dr Pimple Popper removes two growths from man's nose that attract flies
item.description: Former steelworker Roger, 60, from San Antonio, Texas, revealed the lumps started as a small pimple 11 years ago. Roger met Dr. Lee, and revealed she was his last hope as he had no insurance.

item.title: Seek-and-find puzzle challenges you to find the only cherry that's not been eaten by a hungry worm
item.description: The brainteaser is the work of Hungarian viral cartoonist Gergely Dudas, better known as Dudolf , who is known for delighting fans around the world with his playful puzzles.

item.title: Woman, 27, recruited her beautician mum, 47, to help run her boyfriend's drugs empire
item.description: Jamey-Leigh Brook-Parkinson, from Salford, recruited her mother to deal drugs to her friends and planned to exploit her beauty salon to launder money.

item.title: F1 driver Max Verstappen shows he can outrun a 400mph SPITFIRE in a series of challenges
item.description: The Red Bull driver from Holland took on a red London bus, a black cab and even the ubiquitous white van in a lap of the famous Goodwood circuit in west Sussex.

item.title: Catfish UK: Man discovers his hunky online boyfriend of a year is actually a woman enacting revenge
item.description: Alex, 30, a hairdresser from Hastings enlisted the help of hosts Oobah Butler and Julie Adenuga, to track down his boyfriend Matt, after growing suspicious of his partner who would never video chat.

item.title: Headteacher who appeared to blame Bangladeshi families for rising Covid cases to retire
item.description: Karen Todd said she felt 'totally let down' by those in the 'Bangladeshi community'. She has since announced her retirement. after 23 years at Richard Avenue Primary School, in Sunderland.

item.title: Asos share price drops 14% amid Covid fears
item.description: With many bricks-and-mortar stores only just starting to reopening over the period, Asos was able to capitalise on the shutdown and added 1.2million customers to its site.

item.title: Green co-leader Sian Berry QUITS amid furious internal trans rights row
item.description: The London Assembly member and perennial mayoral candidate lashed out at the party's 'mixed messages' on gender identity, suggesting her front bench team did not share her views.

item.title: Washington mother beaten and set alight by abusive ex-husband
item.description: WARNING: DISTRESSING IMAGES. Brenda Welch, 50, from Lake Stevens, Washington, survived the attack but suffered a fractured skull and 23 percent burns to her body.

item.title: NASA will attempt a 'risky' manoeuvre to fix Hubble telescope TODAY
item.description: Hubble accidentally went offline due to a mysterious glitch on June 13 that took down one of its main computers - but the Washington, D.C-based space agency is trying a fix today.

item.title: Men reveal the BIGGEST secrets they're keeping from their wives
item.description: Men from around the world took to anonymous confession-sharing app Whisper to reveal the dark desires and deeply personal thoughts their wives know nothing about.

item.title: Ibiza, Mallorca and Menorca could be added to the 'amber list'
item.description: Summer holiday plans for thousands of Britons were left in tatters tonight after the Balearic islands were axed from the 'green list' after just a fortnight. Bulgaria and Croatia were moved to the green list.

item.title: Bad hiccups, but no immediate surgery for Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro
item.description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was admitted to a hospital for intestinal obstruction, after experiencing hiccups for 10 straight days.
item.media:credit: via REUTERS / AFP via Getty Images

item.title: People given AstraZeneca's Covid jab less likely to have antibodies than those who receive Pfizer's
item.description: Imperial College London experts found that fewer than 85 per cent of over-80s had detectable levels of the virus-fighting proteins two weeks after their second AZ jab.

item.title: Business coach reveals why you should run your family like a 'blue-chip corporation'
item.description: Ex-teacher Rita Chowdhry, 57, of Surrey, believes stressed-out parents should adopt the structure and processes applied in day-to-day operations at the world's most successful firms.

item.title: Flights to Spain still as low as £15 as holidaymakers look to travel to amber list countries
item.description: Flights to amber list countries are available from just £15 with seven night package holidays also selling for as little as £146, new research has revealed.
item.media:credit: Expedia / Shutterstock / Petr Pohudka / Shutterstock / Skumer / Shutterstock / Vladimir Sazonov

item.title: Energy price cap expected to rise by £150 next month: Households urged to keep an eye on bills
item.description: The rising cap is mainly due to the wholesale energy market, where gas prices have increased by 55 per cent since January. They are now at their highest level since 2005 and continue to rise.

item.title: Paul Thomas on…Whitehall ping pilot scheme
item.description: 'He has ALL the symptoms to avoid self-isolating: Ministerial box, Cabinet seat, Government car...'

item.title: Twitter kills Fleets - its rival to Snapchat - after admitting no one used it
item.description: Twitter has announced it is removing Fleets, its disappearing-posts feature, on August 3 after it failed to gain traction with users. The Snapchat rival just launched in November 2020.

item.title: Walking for 40 minutes three times a week can freshen white matter in the brain, study finds
item.description: Colorado State researchers found that walking for 40 minutes a day, three times a week, could help refresh the white brain matter of people over 60 and improve cognitive ability.

item.title: How many people have been 'pinged' by the NHS app in YOUR area?
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: MailOnline can reveal alerts were sent to every area of England during the final seven-day spell of June - with even a handful of residents in the Isles of Scilly told to self-isolate for up to ten days.
